HEADLINE: New York Needed Ventilators. So They Developed One in a Month.
SUMMARY: The pandemic inspired an innovative project to design and make a low-cost ventilator in weeks, not years.

HEADLINE: Zoom’s Security Woes Were No Secret to Business Partners Like Dropbox
SUMMARY: Dropbox privately paid top hackers to find bugs in software by the videoconferencing company Zoom, then pressed it to fix them.

HEADLINE: Facebook to Introduce an App for Gaming
SUMMARY: Video games are surging in popularity in the pandemic. So Facebook is rolling out an app designed for creating and watching live gameplay.

HEADLINE: Take YouTube’s Dangers Seriously
SUMMARY: The website’s features can lead people unwittingly to scary places.

HEADLINE: Apple, in a Virtual Unveiling, Introduces a $399 iPhone
SUMMARY: The new iPhone SE has the design of an older generation of iPhones, with the same computing power as newer ones.

HEADLINE: The Virus Revealed Our Essential Tech (and Weeded Out the Excess)
SUMMARY: A computer with a good internet connection, communication apps and entertainment are the only tech we really need, ever.

HEADLINE: The Art (and Awkwardness) of a Virtual Haircut
SUMMARY: My husband’s hair was looking shaggy. So were my bangs. A hairstylist came to our rescue — or did she? — over video chat.

HEADLINE: Track Down the Mystery Person Who Just Texted You
How to Make the Perfect Playlist
SUMMARY: Need something fresh to listen to? Maybe something inspiring? These tips will help.

HEADLINE: As Amazon Rises, So Does the Opposition
SUMMARY: Stacy Mitchell knew that taking on a trillion-dollar company would be a lopsided fight. But the pandemic has not only made Amazon more essential. It has also made it vulnerable.

HEADLINE: Jobless Claims by Uber and Lyft Drivers Revive Fight Over Labor Status
SUMMARY: California’s move to aid gig workers may break federal rules. But the state said it had few options after the ride-hailing companies resisted other benefits.

HEADLINE: The Pandemic Work Diary of a Video-Streaming C.E.O.
SUMMARY: From her parents’ home, Vimeo’s Anjali Sud oversees 600 employees and surging demand for feeds of documentaries, yoga classes and funerals.

HEADLINE: SpaceX Gets May Date to Launch 2 NASA Astronauts to Space Station
SUMMARY: The crew will be the first to travel to orbit from American soil since the space shuttle stopped flying in 2011.

HEADLINE: A Privacy Absolutist Isn’t So Sure Anymore
SUMMARY: The urgency of the pandemic has made Charlie Warzel, an Opinion writer for The Times, question his beliefs on the dangers of location tracking.

HEADLINE: Uber and Lyft Are Searching for Lifelines
SUMMARY: The ride-hailing competitors started the year with optimism. Now, like most other companies, they’re trying to survive the cratering economy.

HEADLINE: France Weighs Its Love of Liberty in Fight Against Coronavirus
SUMMARY: The French are cautiously considering digital tracking, which has proved effective in Asia. But can a country that so prizes personal freedom and privacy ever accept it?

HEADLINE: When Even Amazon Is Sold Out of Exploding Kittens
SUMMARY: Sometimes products are in stock. Sometimes they aren’t. And delivery times vary widely. A virus-fueled surge in orders has created chaos behind the scenes, and confusion for customers.

HEADLINE: Bill Gates, at Odds With Trump on Virus, Becomes a Right-Wing Target
SUMMARY: The Microsoft co-founder turned philanthropist has been attacked with falsehoods that he created the coronavirus and wants to profit from it.

HEADLINE: The Difference Between Copyrights, Trademarks and Patents
SUMMARY: Whether you’re an inventor, a writer or an artist, you need to know what these each mean — and which you need to protect your work.
